channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Germany sees anti-Pride events and restricts rainbow flags ahead of LGBTQ+ parties
item.description: The head of parliament banned the rainbow flag from the legislative building. Far-right groups have rallied against the LGBTQ+ community and attacks are on the rise. It all casts a shadow over Pride.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump visits the Federal Reserve's headquarters, questions about Epstein files follow lawmakers home, as starvation spreads in Gaza, ceasefire talks stall.

item.title: What the MAGA base thinks about the Epstein investigation
item.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer speaks with political analyst and pollster Frank Luntz about how Trump's most loyal supporters think about the controversy surrounding the so-called Epstein files.

item.title: A look at Hulk Hogan's legacy
item.description: Hogan, whose real name is Terry Bollea, was one of the earliest stars of World Wrestling Entertainment and was the face of pro wrestling's boom in popularity during the 1980s.

item.title: Trump is going to Scotland. The Epstein questions likely will follow him there
item.description: President Trump is spending some time at a golf course he owns in Scotland this weekend -- and plans to meet British Prime Minister Kier Starmer during the trip.

item.title: Once considered a safe investment, U.S. Treasuries now feel shakier
item.description: For decades, U.S. Treasuries have been among the safest investments. But in recent months, trust in U.S. Treasuries has felt shakier.

item.title: New research suggests a way to prevent the spread of Malaria
item.description: A new study reports on a novel way to short-circuit the parasite that spreads Malaria, so people wouldn't get infected with a mosquito's bite.

item.title: Trump visits the Federal Reserve's headquarters
item.description: President Trump personally inspected renovations of the Federal Reserve's headquarters, part of a pressure campaign on its chair Jerome Powell.

item.title: As starvation spreads in Gaza, ceasefire talks stall
item.description: As starvation spreads in Gaza, the U.S. has cut short ceasefire talks. Meanwhile, France has announced it plans to recognize Palestine as a state.
